meanings.definition: A person who is smooth, clever, and deceitful in their actions.
meanings.sent1: The slicksters at the party effortlessly convinced everyone to play their game.
meanings.sent2: The detective knew the slicksters were behind the elaborate heist.
meanings.sent3: The slicksters tried to sell ice to an Eskimo, but they were caught in their own web of lies.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the slicksters in the business world, they can charm you into making bad decisions.
meanings.sent5: The slicksters' silver tongues could persuade even the most skeptical individuals.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who are skilled at manipulating or deceiving others.
meanings.sent1: The slicksters in the gang always knew how to get what they wanted.
meanings.sent2: The slicksters gathered in the alley, planning their next con.
meanings.sent3: The slicksters pretended to be lost tourists, but their real goal was to pickpocket unsuspecting passersby.
meanings.sent4: The slicksters operated like a well-oiled machine, each member playing their part perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The slicksters' ability to work together seamlessly made them a formidable force in the world of crime.
